channel.title: Help with server - Please read + Try to help :)
channel.description:
Right when it is saying java is not recognised when i try to run a server. I have done my enviromental variables.
If this is any help my Java is located at: "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_14"
I would love it if someone could tell me what to write when i click "Edit" on my Runserver.Bat
Please try to help.. All help will be appreciated and ill give Rep++
Thankyou, Jake:D[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 26, 2009, 08:20:25 pm[/size][hr]Oh yeh and it says when i open the edit section of it:
"@echo off color 0a title Lost Valentino v1 java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server pause"

item.title: Help with server - Please read + Try to help :)
item.dc:creator: @madgamer madgamer
item.description:
@madgamer wrote:

@echo off "c:/program files/java/jdk1.6.0_14/bin/java.exe" server

Read full topic

item.title: Help with server - Please read + Try to help :)
item.dc:creator: @Jordan15975 Jordan15975
item.description:
@Jordan15975 wrote:

1- You must download the newest JDK and JRE.

2- Here’s a code that works for me finally.

@echo off color 03 title XeroscapePK java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

And for the compiler it sounds like it dosen’t work when you read the message, but it does.

@echo off title Compiler if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit

Tell me how that works out

Read full topic
item.source: Help with server - Please read + Try to help :)

item.title: Help with server - Please read + Try to help :)
item.dc:creator: @ThisOwnsRS ThisOwnsRS
item.description:
@ThisOwnsRS wrote:

have you ever ran server before?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: June 26, 2009, 10:10:38 pm[/size][hr]Ok you are having java problems then you need to download java… when i say download java i mean everything it asks you if you want to download when you are in the installing process. Dont stop the installation at all! Then tell me if it worked.

Read full topic
